item.title: Ticket #768 (Add support for additional arguments to filters) updated
item.dc:creator: morganiq
item.description:
Not also that call_user_func_array() could be called in place of call_user_func(), to pass additional arguments into filter functions as normal list of arguments rather than as a single array.

function apply_filters($tag, $string, $filter = true) {

global $wp_filter;

+ + if ($filter) + $args = array($string) + array_slice(func_get_args(), 3); + else + $args = array($string) + func_get_arg(3); +

if (isset($wp_filterall?)) {

foreach ($wp_filterall? as $priority => $functions) {

if (isset($wp_filter[$tag][$priority]))

$wp_filter[$tag][$priority] = array_merge($wp_filterall?[$priority], $wp_filter[$tag][$priority]);

else

$wp_filter[$tag][$priority] = array_merge($wp_filterall?[$priority], array());

$wp_filter[$tag][$priority] = array_unique($wp_filter[$tag][$priority]);

}

}

if (isset($wp_filter[$tag])) {

ksort($wp_filter[$tag]); foreach ($wp_filter[$tag] as $priority => $functions) {

if (!is_null($functions)) {

foreach($functions as $function) {

if ($filter)

! $string = call_user_func_array($function, $args);

else

! call_user_func_array($function, $args);

}

}

}

} return $string;

}

Note also that call_user_func_array() can pass values by reference, whereas call_user_func() cannot.

item.title: Ticket #768 (Add support for additional arguments to filters) updated
item.dc:creator: morganiq

item.title: Ticket #768 (Add support for additional arguments to filters) updated
item.dc:creator: morganiq

item.title: Ticket #768 (Add support for additional arguments to filters) created
item.dc:creator: morganiq
item.description: It is often difficult or impossible within a filter to discover the context with which the function being filtered was called. For example, get_permalink() takes an optional $id argument; when this argument is used, it is unknown to the filter which post id has been passed. Suggest adding support for passing additional arguments to filters, and passing useful information to apply_filters() where appropriate.

item.title: Ticket #766 (More and next page tags produce unwanted results) updated
item.dc:creator: ccf

item.title: Ticket #766 (More and next page tags produce unwanted results) created
item.dc:creator: ccf
item.description:
When inserting <!--nextpage--> or <!--more--> into a post 1) the next comments section gets aligned in the middle 2) the rest of the page has smaller font than the beginning.

I have tried several times to insert these tags at different points in my blog, and they produce the same effect. As I have no test blog, and don't want to ruin the aspect of my current blog, I cannot show you.

item.description: When the 'locale' filter is applied, plugins have not yet loaded, preventing them from being able to use the filter.

item.title: Ticket #761 (Add hook to conditionally disable comment notifications) updated
item.dc:creator: coffee2code

item.title: Ticket #761 (Add hook to conditionally disable comment notifications) created
item.dc:creator: coffee2code
item.description: E-mail notifications for posted comments are controlled by the 'comments_notify' setting. E-mail notifications for comments needing modification are controlled by the 'moderation_notify' setting. Each is an all or nothing setting, i.e. if 'on', ALL post authors will receive notifications when appropriate. AFAIK, there isn't a clean way for a plugin to insert itself into the notification process.

item.title: Ticket #760 (Admin Authors page should also indicate number of draft for each ...) updated
item.dc:creator: coffee2code

item.title: Ticket #760 (Admin Authors page should also indicate number of draft for each ...) created
item.dc:creator: coffee2code
item.description: The "Authors & Users" subpage under "Users" in the Admin section should also indicate the number of drafts each author has, especially since there is no real way of assessing who has how many drafts (the "Manage" page will of course list the titles of all drafts, and of course a click-through on each will reveal the authors, but summarizing the draft count on a per-author basis might be of value).

item.title: Ticket #759 (Cannot make NEW post as another author, despite input field to do so ...) updated
item.dc:creator: coffee2code

item.title: Ticket #759 (Cannot make NEW post as another author, despite input field to do so ...) created
item.dc:creator: coffee2code
item.description: The Advanced version of post.php presents appropriately leveled authors the option to make a new post as another author. However, the value for the field is never taken into consideration and the post is always assigned to the true author. (The "Post author" field is currently only taken into consideration when a post is being edited.)

item.title: Ticket #758 (Draft content gets filtered, possibly munging data [w/ patch]) updated
item.dc:creator: coffee2code

item.title: Ticket #758 (Draft content gets filtered, possibly munging data [w/ patch]) created
item.dc:creator: coffee2code
item.description: Drafts are not always completed posts (perhaps having been saved in mid-writing to avoid losing the post in an unexpected browser crash). Since both the excerpt and content text get filtered, this could lead to problems, such as the balanceTags filter tacking close tags to the end of the incomplete post. Who knows what other filters/plugins would do to partial posts saved as drafts.

item.title: Ticket #757 (options-permalink.php refers to old name for 'Uncategorized') created

item.description: In options-permalink.php, an example still refers to the old name of category 1: '/taxonomy/categorias/general/'. Suggest changing to '/taxonomy/categorias/uncategorized/'.
